Ratusan Orang Geruduk Kantor Sri Mulyani, Tolak Kenaikan Cukai Rokok
04 Nov 2019, 03:48 by Vadhia Lidyana


Foto: Vadhia Lidyana

Jakarta - Asosiasi Petani Tembakau Indonesia (APTI) Jawa Barat pagi ini mendatangi kantor Kementerian Keuangan (Kemenkeu) dalam rangka mengajukan unjuk rasa penolakan kenaikan cukai hasil tembakau (rokok).Berdasarkan pantauan detikcom, sekitar 400 orang petani tembakau beraksi di depan kantor Menteri Keuangan Sri Mulyani Indrawati. Segerombolan petani tersebut berangkat dari Garut dan memulai aksinya di depan kantor Kemenkeu sejak pukul 9.15 WIB."Ada sekitar 8 bus, kurang lebih 400 orang mulai berkumpulnya pukul 9.15 WIB," ungkap IPTU Suryansyah yang berjaga di sekitar lokasi kepada detikcom, Senin (4/11/2019).Ia mengungkapkan, sekitar 250 orang personel kepolisian dari Polda Metro Jaya, Polres Jakarta Pusat, dan Polsek Sawah Besar turut mengawal aksi unjuk rasa ini.Adapun poin-poin yang diprotes APTI Jawa Barat pagi ini ada dua, yaitu mengenai Peraturan Menteri Keuangan (PMK) nomor 222 tahun 2017 tentang Dana Bagi Hasil Cukai dan Hasil Tembakau (DBH CHT), dan PMK nomor 152 tahun 2019 tentang kenaikan cukai hasil tembakau dan harga jual eceran (HJE).IPTU Suryansyah mengatakan, saat ini ada 12 orang perwakilan APTI Jawa Barat yang sedang menemui Direktur Jenderal (Dirjen) Bea dan Cukai Kemenkeu Heru Pambudi.Pertemuan tersebut sudah berlangsung kurang lebih selama 40 menit.

Hundreds of People Occupy the Sri Mulyani Office, Reject the Increase in Cigarette Excise
04 Nov 2019, 03:48 by Vadhia Lidyana


Photo: Vadhia Lidyana

Jakarta - Indonesian Tobacco Farmers Association (APTI) West Java this morning visited the office of the Ministry of Finance (Ministry of Finance) in order to submit a protest against the increase in excise on tobacco products (cigarettes). Based on the monitoring of detikcom, around 400 tobacco farmers acted in front of the Minister of Finance's office Mulyani Indrawati. A group of farmers departed from Garut and started the action in front of the Ministry of Finance office at 9.15 WIB. "There were about 8 buses, approximately 400 people started gathering at 9.15 WIB," said IPTU Suryansyah who was guarding around the location to detikcom, Monday (4 / 11/2019). He revealed that around 250 police personnel from the Jakarta Metropolitan Police, Central Jakarta Police, and Sawah Besar Police Precinct took part in guarding the demonstration. As for the points protested by APTI West Java this morning there were two, namely regarding the Regulations Minister of Finance (PMK) number 222 of 2017 concerning Excise Sharing Funds and Tobacco Products (DBH CHT), and PMK number 152 of 2019 concerning increases in excise on tobacco products and retail selling prices (HJE). IPTU Suryansyah said, currently there are 12 people West Java APTI representative who was meeting the Director General (Dirjen) of Customs and Excise of the Ministry of Finance Heru Pambudi. The meeting had lasted approximately 40 minutes.
